.addHealthPool.description: Adds a temporary health pool to a player or players. This health pool can be referenced using the Last Created Health Pool value. Up to 16 health pools of a given health type (health, armor, or shields) may exist on a player (including base pools and pools generated by abilities).

args.name: player
args.description: The player or players whose movement collision is affected.

args.name: healthType
args.description: Specifies the type of health (Armor or shields) contained in the Health Pool.

args.name: maxHealth
args.description: The size of the health pool

args.name: isRecoverable
args.description: Whether health in this pool can be healed once it is lost. If this is value is false, then the health pool will shrink and disappear as it is damaged.

args.name: reevaluation
args.description: If set to true and Recoverable is also true, then Max Health will be reevaluated every frame. Else, Max Health is only evaluated once when this action executes.

.addHealthPool.es-MX: Añadir cantidad de salud a jugador
.addHealthPool.fr-FR: Ajouter une réserve de points de vie à un joueur
.addHealthPool.ja-JP: プレイヤーにライフプールを追加
.addHealthPool.pt-BR: Adicionar Reserva de Vida para Jogador
.addHealthPool.th-TH: เพิ่มบ่อพลังชีวิตให้กับผู้เล่น

.addToScore.description: Modifies the score (kill count) of one or more players. This action only has an effect in free-for-all modes.

args.name: player
args.description: The player or players whose score will change.

args.name: score
args.description: The amount the score will increase or decrease. If positive, the score will increase. If negative, the score will decrease.

.applyImpulse.description: Applies an instantaneous change in velocity to the movement of one or more players.

args.name: player
args.description: The player or players whose velocity will be changed.

args.name: direction
args.description: The unit direction in which the impulse will be applied. This value is normalized internally.

args.name: speed
args.description: The magnitude of the change to the velocities of the player or players.

args.name: relativity
args.description: Specifies whether direction is relative to world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

args.name: motion
args.description: Specifies whether existing velocity that is counter to direction should first be cancelled out before applying the impulse.

.applyImpulse.th-TH: ใช้พลังผลักดัน

.attachTo.description: Attaches the player (the 'child') to another player (the 'parent'). Once attached, the child will be unable to move freely until detached or teleported away. Multiple children may be attached to the same parent, but not vice versa.

args.name: child
args.description: The player that will attach to the parent. This player will be unable to move freely until detached or teleported away.

args.name: parent
args.description: The player to whom the child will attach. This player's movement will be unaffected and will determine the child's position.

args.name: offset
args.description: The coordinates of the child relative to the parent. For example, `vect(1,2,0)` would be above and to the left of the parent's head.

.startForcingThrottle.description: Defines minimum and maximum movement input values for one or more players, possibly forcing or preventing movement.

args.description: Sets the maximum run forward amount. 0 prevents the player or players from moving forward while 1 allows full forward movement.

args.name: minBackward
args.description: Sets the minimum run backward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full backward movement.

args.name: maxBackward
args.description: Sets the maximum run backward amount. 0 prevents the player or players from moving backward while 1 allows full backward movement.

args.name: minSideways
args.description: Sets the minimum run sideways amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full sideways movement.

.startThrottleInDirection.description: Sets or adds to the throttle (directional input control) of a player or players such that they begin moving in a particular direction. Any previous throttle in direction is cancelled.

.startTransformingThrottle.description: Starts transforming (scaling and rotating) the throttle (directional input control) of a player or players. Cancels any existing start transforming throttle behavior.

args.name: yAxisScalar
args.description: The player or players will have their throttle Y axis (front to back) multiplied by this value before the throttle is rotated to its new relative direction. This value is evaluated continuously (meaning it updates every frame).

args.name: relativeDirection
args.description: After the axis scalars are applied, the player or players will have their throttle transformed so that it is relative to this unit direction vector. For example, to make the throttle camera relative, provide the direction that the camera is facing. This value is evaluated continuously (meaning it updates every frame) and normalized internally.

__callSubroutine__.description: Pauses execution of the current rule and begins executing a subroutine rule (which is a rule with a subroutine event type). args.name: subroutine
args.description: Specifies which subroutine to call. If a rule with a subroutine event type specifies the same subroutine, then it will execute. Otherwise, this action is ignored.

__elif__.description: Denotes the beginning of a series of actions that will only execute if the specified condition is true and the previous If or Else If action's condition was false.

args.name: condition
args.description: If this evaluates to true, execution continues with the next action. Otherwise, execution jumps to the next else if, else, or end action at the current level.

__else__.description: Denotes the beginning of a series of actions that will only execute if the previous If or Else If action's condition was false.

__end__.description: Denotes the end of a series of actions started by an if, else if, else, while, or for action.

__forGlobalVariable__.description: Denotes the beginning of a series of actions that will execute in a loop, modifying the control variable on each loop. The corresponding end action denotes the end of the loop. If the control variable reaches or passes the range stop value, then the loop exits, and execution jumps to the next action after the end action.

args.name: controlVariable
args.description: The variable being modified in this loop. It is set to the range start value when the loop begins, and the loop continues until the control variable reaches or passes the range stop value.

args.name: rangeStart
args.description: The control variable is set to this value when the loop begins.

args.name: rangeStop
args.description: If the control variable reaches or passes this value, then the loop will exit, and execution jumps to the next action after the end action. Whether this value is considered passed or not is based on whether the step value is negative or positive. If the control variable has already reached or passed this value when the loop begins, then the loop exits.

args.name: step
args.description: This value is added to the control variable when the end action is reached. If this modification causes the control variable to reach or pass the range stop value, then the loop exits, and execution jumps to the next action after the end action. Otherwise, the loop continues, and execution jumps to the next action after the for action.

__forPlayerVariable__.description: Denotes the beginning of a series of actions that will execute in a loop, modifying the control variable on each loop. The corresponding end action denotes the end of the loop. If the control variable reaches or passes the range stop value, then the loop exits, and execution jumps to the next action after the end action.

args.name: controlPlayer
args.description: The player whose variable is being modified in this loop. If multiple players are specified, the first player is used.

args.name: controlVariable
args.description: The variable being modified in this loop. It is set to the range start value when the loop begins, and the loop continues until the control variable reaches or passes the range stop value.

args.name: rangeStart
args.description: The control variable is set to this value when the loop begins.

args.name: rangeStop
args.description: If the control variable reaches or passes this value, then the loop will exit, and execution jumps to the next action after the end action. Whether this value is considered passed or not is based on whether the step value is negative or positive. If the control variable has already reached or passed this value when the loop begins, then the loop exits.

args.name: step
args.description: This value is added to the control variable when the end action is reached. If this modification causes the control variable to reach or pass the range stop value, then the loop exits, and execution jumps to the next action after the end action. Otherwise, the loop continues, and execution jumps to the next action after the for action.

hudText.description:
Creates hud text visible to specific players at a specific location on the screen. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this text, use the last text id value. This action will fail if too many text elements have been created.

Note: you can use the macros `hudHeader`, `hudSubheader` and `hudSubtext` to reduce the number of arguments.

args.name: visibleTo
args.description: One or more players who will see the hud text.

args.name: header
args.description: The text to be displayed (can be blank)

args.name: subheader

__if__.description: Denotes the beginning of a series of actions that will only execute if the specified condition is true.

args.name: condition
args.description: If this evaluates to true, execution continues with the next action. Otherwise, execution jumps to the next else if, else, or end action at the current level.

__loopIfConditionIsFalse__.description: Restarts the action list from the beginning if at least one condition in the condition list is false. If all conditions are true, execution continues with the next action.
__loopIfConditionIsFalse__.es-MX: Repetir si la condición es falsa

__loopIfConditionIsTrue__.description: Restarts the action list from the beginning if every condition in the condition list is true. If any are false, execution continues with the next action.

__loopIfConditionIsTrue__.fr-FR: Boucle si la condition est vraie
__loopIfConditionIsTrue__.pt-BR: Gerar Loop se a Condição for Verdadeira
__loopIfConditionIsTrue__.th-TH: ลูปถ้าเงื่อนไขเป็นจริง

__loopIf__.description: Restarts the action list from the beginning if this action's condition evaluates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next action.

args.name: condition
args.description: Specifies whether the loop will occur.

loop.description: Restarts the action list from the beginning.

__modifyGlobalVariableAtIndex__.description: Modifies the value of a global variable at an index, which is a variable that belongs to the game itself.

args.name: variable
args.description: The global variable to modify.

args.name: index
args.description: The index of the array to modify. If the index is beyond the end of the array, the array is extended with new elements given a value of zero.

args.name: operation
args.description: The way in which the variable's value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

args.name: value
args.description: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of the two operands, with the other being the variable's existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove.

__skipIf__.description: Skips execution of a certain number of actions in the action list if this action's condition evaluates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next action.

args.name: condition
args.description: Specifies whether the skip occurs.

args.name: numberOfActions
args.description: The number of actions to skip, not including this action.

__skip__.description: Skips execution of a certain number of actions in the action list.

args.name: numberOfActions
args.description: The number of actions to skip, not including this action.

async.description: Begins simultaneous execution of a subroutine rule (which is a rule with a Subroutine event type). Execution of the original rule continues uninterrupted. The subroutine will have access to the same contextual values (such as Event Player) as the original rule.

args.name: subroutine
args.description: Specifies which subroutine to start. If a rule with a subroutine event type specifies the same subroutine, then it will execute. Otherwise, this action is ignored.

args.name: ifAlreadyExecuting
args.description: Determines what should happen if the rule specified by the subroutine is already executing on the same player or global entity.

wait.description: Pauses the execution of the action list. Unless the wait is interrupted, the remainder of the actions will execute after the pause.

args.name: time
args.description: The duration of the pause.

args.name: waitBehavior
args.description: Specifies if and how the wait can be interrupted. If the condition list is ignored, the wait will not be interrupted. Otherwise, the condition list will determine if and when the action list will abort or restart.

__while__.description: Denotes the beginning of a series of actions that will execute in a loop as long as the specified condition is true. The next end action at the current level denotes the end of the loop. If the condition evaluates to false when execution is at the top of the loop, then the loop exits, and execution jumps to the next action after the end action.

args.name: condition
args.description: If this evaluates to true, execution continues with the next action. Otherwise, execution jumps to the next end action at the current level.

addToTeamScore.description: Modifies the score of one or both teams. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes or modes without a team score.

args.name: team
args.description: The team or teams whose score will be changed.

args.name: score
args.description: The amount the score will increase or decrease. If positive, the score will increase. If negative, the score will decrease.

addToTeamScore.th-TH: ปรับเปลี่ยนคะแนนของทีม

args.description: The message to be displayed.

break.description: Goes to the end of the innermost `switch` statement, or `do/while`, `while` or `for` loop.

continue.description: Goes back to the start of the innermost loop.

createBeam.description: Creates an in-world beam effect entity. This effect entity will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

args.name: visibleTo
args.description: One or more players who will be able to see the effect.

args.name: type
args.description: The type of effect to be created.

args.name: startPosition
args.description: The effect's start position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: endPosition
args.description: The effect's end position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: color
args.description: The color of the beam to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer. Does not apply to sound effects. Only the "good" and "bad" beam effects can have color applied.

args.name: reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. The effect will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

createBeam.ja-JP: ビーム・エフェクトを作成
createBeam.th-TH: สร้างเอฟเฟกต์ลำแสง

createDummy.description: Adds a new bot to the specified slot on the specified team so long as the slot is available. This bot will only move, fire, or use abilities if executing workshop actions.

args.name: hero
args.description: The hero that the bot will be. If more than one hero is provided, one will be chosen at random.

args.name: team
args.description: The team on which to create the bot. The "all" option only works in free-for-all game modes, while the "team" options only work in team-based game modes.

args.name: slot
args.description: The player slot which will receive the bot (-1 for first available slot). Up to 6 bots may be added to each team, or 12 bots to the free-for-all team, regardless of lobby settings.

args.name: position
args.description: The initial position where the bot will appear.

args.name: facing
args.description: The initial direction that the bot will face.

createDummy.th-TH: สร้างบอตฝึกซ้อม

createEffect.description: Creates an in-world effect entity. This effect entity will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

args.name: visibleTo
args.description: One or more players who will be able to see the effect.

args.name: type
args.description: The type of effect to be created.

args.name: color
args.description: The color of the effect to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer. Does not apply to sound effects. Does not support Custom Color.

args.name: position
args.description: The effect's position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: radius
args.description: The radius of this effect.

args.name: reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated.

createEffect.th-TH: สร้างเอฟเฟกต์

createIcon.description: Creates an in-world icon entity. This icon entity will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this entity, use the getLastCreatedEntity() value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

args.name: visibleTo
args.description: One or more players who will be able to see the icon.

args.name: position
args.description: The icon's position. If this value is a player, then the icon will appear above the player's head. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: icon
args.description: The icon to be created.

args.name: reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. The icon will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

args.name: color
args.description: The color of the icon to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer.

args.name: showWhenOffscreen
args.description: Should this icon appear even when it is behind you?

createIcon.th-TH: สร้างไอคอน

createInWorldText.description: Creates in-world text visible to specific players at a specific position in the world. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this text, use the getLastTextId() value. This action will fail if too many text elements have been created.

args.name: visibleTo
args.description: One or more players who will see the in-world text.

args.name: text
args.description: The text to be displayed.

args.name: position
args.description: The text's position. If this value is a player, then the text will appear above the player's head. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: scale
args.description: The text's scale.

args.name: clipping
args.description: Specifies whether the text can be seen through walls or is instead clipped.

args.name: reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. The text will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

args.name: color
args.description: Specifies the color of the in-world text to use.

args.name: specVisibility
args.description: Whether spectators can see the text or not.

createInWorldText.ja-JP: ワールド内テキストを作成
createInWorldText.th-TH: สร้างข้อความในโลก

args.name: scale

args.name: clipping
args.description: Specifies whether the text can be seen through walls or is instead clipped.

args.name: progressBarColor

args.name: textColor
args.description: The color of the text to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer.

args.name: reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. The text will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

args.name: specVisibility
args.description: Whether spectators can see the text or not.

heal.description: Provides an instantaneous heal to one or more players. This heal will not resurrect dead players.

args.name: player
args.description: The player or players whose health will be restored.

args.name: healer
args.description: The player who will receive credit for the healing. A healer of null indicates no player will receive credit.

args.name: amount
args.description: The amount of healing to apply. This amount may be modified by buff or debuffs. Healing is capped by each player's max health.

kill.description: Instantly kills one or more players.

args.name: player
args.description: The player or players who will be killed.

args.name: killer
args.description: The player who will receive credit for the kill. A killer of null indicates no player will receive credit.

.moveToTeam.description: Moves one or more players to the specified team and slot. This action can fail if the specified slot is not available. This action doesn't work on dummy bots.

args.name: player
args.description: The player or players to move.

args.name: team
args.description: The team on which to move the Player. The "all" option only works in free-for-all game modes, while the "team" options only work in team-based game modes.

args.name: slot
args.description: The player slot which will receive the player (-1 for first available slot).

.moveToTeam.ja-JP: プレイヤーをチームに移動
.moveToTeam.th-TH: ย้ายผู้เล่นไปยังทีม

pauseMatchTime.description: Pauses the match time. Players, objective logic, and game mode advancement criteria are unaffected by the pause.

pauseMatchTime.th-TH: หยุดเวลาแมตช์ชั่วคราว

playEffect.description: Plays an effect at a position in the world. The lifetime of this effect is short, so it does not need to be updated or destroyed.

args.name: visibleTo
args.description: One or more players who will be able to see the effect.

args.name: type
args.description: The type of effect to be created.

args.name: color
args.description: The color of the effect to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer. Does not support Custom Color.

args.name: position
args.description: The effect's position. If this value is a player, then the effect will play at the player's position. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: radius
args.description: The effect's radius in meters.

playEffect.th-TH: เอฟเฟกต์การเล่น

logToInspector.description: Causes the workshop inspector to record a log entry.

progressBarHud.description: Creates a progress bar HUD text visible to specified players at a specific location on the screen. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this text, use the getLastTextId() value. This action will fail if too many text elements have been created.

args.name: visibleTo
args.description: One or more players who will see the Progress Bar HUD text.

args.name: value
args.description: The value of the progress bar to be displayed as a percentage from 0 to 100.

args.name: text
args.description: The text to be displayed (can be blank)

args.name: location
args.description: The location on the screen where the text will appear.

args.name: sortOrder
args.description: The sort order of the text relative to other text in the same location. Text with a higher sort order will come after the text with a lower sort order.

args.name: progressBarColor
args.description: The color of the progress bar to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer.

args.name: textColor
args.description: The color of the text to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer.

args.name: reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. The text will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

args.name: specVisibility
args.description: Whether spectators can see the text or not.

progressBarHud.es-MX: Crear texto del HUD en la barra de progreso
progressBarHud.fr-FR: Créer du texte d’interface de barre de progression
progressBarHud.ja-JP: 進行バーHUDテキストを作成
progressBarHud.pt-BR: Criar Texto de HUD da Barra de Progresso

progressBarHud.tr-TR: İlerleyiş Çubuğu Ekran Göstergesi Metni Oluştur

startDamageModification.description: Starts modifying how much damage one or more receivers will receive from one or more damagers. args.description: The percentage of damage that will apply to receivers when attacked by damagers.

args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

waitUntil.description: Waits until the Continue Condition is true or Timeout seconds elapse. The rule conditions are ignored during this wait.

args.name: continueCondition
args.description: If this value becomes true, the wait concludes, and the next action in the action list begins executing.

args.name: timeout
args.description: If this many seconds elapse, the wait concludes, and the next action in the action list begins executing.

createProjectile.description: Creates a projectile entity that either heals or damages players and player-owned entities. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

args.name: type
args.description: The type of projectile to be created. New options can be added to this list by enabling the Projectiles workshop extension.

args.name: player
args.description: The player who owns this projectile and will receive credit for kills. If null, the projectile will be owned by nobody. The projectile will not affect its owner.

args.name: startPosition
args.description: The start position of the projectile. If null, the player's eye position will be used.

args.name: direction
args.description: The direction for the projectile to travel. If null, the player's facing direction will be used.

args.name: relativity
args.description: Whether the projectile's start position and direction are relative to the player or to the world.

args.name: modifyHealthType
args.description: Whether the projectile will heal or damage targets it collides with.

args.name: affectedTeam
args.description: Which team the projectile will collide with. The projectile will never affect its owner regardless of team.

args.name: damage
args.description: The amount of damage or healing the projectile will apply to targets it collides with. If explosion radius is set to an amount greater than 0, this is how much damage the explosion will do at its center.

args.name: damageScalar
args.description: If explosion radius is set to 0 this is how much to scale the damage amount for critical hits. If the explosion radius is greater than 0 this is how much damage the projectile will do at the edge of the explosion.

args.name: explosionRadius
args.description: The radius of the explosion created by this projectile. If 0, this projectile doesn't create an explosion.

args.name: explosionEffect
args.description: The effect to use when the projectile explodes. If explosion radius is 0 this effect will not be created.

args.name: explosionSound
args.description: The sound effect to use when the projectile explodes. If explosion radius is 0 this effect will not be created.

args.name: oversize
args.description: A 0 to 1 range for how oversized the projectile should be, 0 being the default size, 1 being the maximum allowed size. The maximum allowed size is different for each projectile type.

args.name: speed
args.description: The speed in meters per second that the projectile will travel along its direction. (0.1 to 1000)

args.name: lifetime
args.description: How long in seconds before the projectile expires.

args.name: impulseStrength
args.description: The strength of the impulse to apply to a target when hit by this projectile. If explosion radius greater than 0, this impulse will applied to all targets affected by the explosion.

args.name: ricochetCount
args.description: How many times the projectile will ricochet off the environment before expiring.

args.name: gravity
args.description: The amount of gravity affecting the projectile, creating an arc. If negative, the projectile will arc upwards.

createProjectile.th-TH: สร้างโพรเจกไทล์

createHomingProjectile.description: Creates a projectile entity that either heals or damages players and player-owned entities. The projectile follows the provided target with variable strength. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

args.name: startPosition

args.name: direction

args.description: Which team the projectile will collide with. The projectile will never affect its owner regardless of team.

args.name: homingTarget

createProjectileEffect.description: Creates an in-world projectile effect entity. This effect entity will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

args.name: visibleTo
args.description: One or more players who will be able to see the effect.

args.name: type
args.description: The type of projectile to be created. New options can be added to this list by enabling the Projectiles Workshop Extension.

args.name: friendlyTo
args.description: One or more players who the projectile will appear friendly to.

args.name: position
args.description: The position of the effect.

args.name: direction
args.description: The facing direction of the effect.

args.name: oversize
args.description: A 0 to 1 range for how oversized the projectile should be, 0 being the default size, 1 being the maximum allowed size. The maximum allowed size is different for each projectile type.

args.name: reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. The effect will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.
